title: Cool down ping. Remapping from Alt+Click
body:
So. 

A long while back I had moved my mapping of Alt+click to be my attack move, and I can't for the life of me figure out where to change the settings to put the Cooldown ping to another mapping, and I can't figure out how to restore the default keys and just remap thigns.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

replies.body:
I'm not able to assist in modifying your hotkeys with any special configurations outside of what's available in-game, but I can *definitely* help you reset your hotkeys if you want them to go back to default. The guide below should fix you right up!

**Log into the game** then hop into **a custom game**. *Alt+Tab* out of the match, then navigate to your config folder, which should be in your install directory:

**C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config**

>Delete these two files:
**-input.ini
-PersistedSettings.json**

After deleting those files, leave the current match, then hop into a fresh one to confirm the changes went through. Let me know if this did the trick!

Hey I wanted to give an update to this as I discovered something.

There is an in game key binding option called "Quick Alert Ping" in the communications tab.  If that gets changed the cooldown alert ping gets changed, and in my experience didn't work.  I had changed my quick alert ping to 'G', so I would just hold G drag and release and that gave me the ping.  This made the cd ping not work.  By restoring that to the default value my cooldown ping began working again.  I simply put 'G' as my secondary "Quick Alert Ping" and now my pings work with holding and releasing 'G' and alt+clicking for cd ping.

Hey so I got this issue again, but in a weird way.

So I remapped my keys.  I used to have laugh on 'T'.  So I know the mapping kept, but the alt click is gone again.

Any ideas?
Are you binding your attack+move to Alt + M2 or Alt + M1? Attack+move only works on right clicks, so any configuration for it to work with left click may not work at all.

Is there an update coming up that will allow us to remap the cd ping?

Interesting. You mentioned:
> So I remapped my keys.  I used to have laugh on 'T'.  So I know the mapping kept, but the alt click is gone again.

So I wasn't sure if you remapped your keys and had issues with the alt+click or not. Maybe try the reset and see if the default settings work. It's possible some of your custom mappings of keys are problematic.

I apologize.  Before I had reset the configuration the first time, I had laugh set to "T".  This also had a mapping with Alt+click

AFTER the reset I mapped "T" to MIA ping. This time I changed nothing with Alt+click.

After the reset the ping was working just fine, for a few games....
Then it just stopped working.  My Alt+click isn't the CD ping, nor is it the attack move, but "T" remained as the MIA ping (Post reset.)

I will reset again, but this would be much easier if I had a way to map it in the options menu.  Personally I don't like that ping being on Alt+click.

Gotcha. I forgot to mention previously that any configurations that happen outside of the Options menu can often break your hotkeys/bindings, so if this keeps happening, it simply may not be a possible configuration.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
